instruction: What metric was chosen to predict net primary productivity (NPP) in pure Pinus nigra J.F. Arnold (Crimean pine) stands and how far can this metric go?
Output:
The metric chosen to evaluate the prediction accuracy to predict net primary productivity (NPP) in pure Pinus nigra J.F. Arnold (Crimean pine) stands was the determination coefficient (R2). The R2 value indicates the proportion of the variance in the dependent variable (NPP) that can be explained by the independent variables (spectral characteristics, land use, soils, and meteorological information). 

The R2 value can range from 0 to 1, with a higher value indicating a better fit of the model to the data. In the related study, the R2 values obtained for the prediction of NPP using different methods ranged up to 0.95, which suggests a strong relationship between the independent variables and NPP.

Output: The machine learning methods used to predict net primary productivity (NPP) in pure Pinus nigra J.F. Arnold (Crimean pine) stands were multiple linear regression (MLR), support vector machines (SVM), and deep learning (DL).

instruction: Can the use of TEX data in the SVM method and Sentinel-2 sensor combination be considered superior to traditional methods in predicting net primary productivity (NPP) in pure Pinus nigra J.F. Arnold (Crimean pine) stands?
Output: Yes, the use of TEX data in the SVM method and Sentinel-2 sensor combination can be considered superior to traditional methods in predicting net primary productivity (NPP) in pure Pinus nigra J.F.
